name: rescreen
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to test or examine someone or something again to discover if there is anything wrong with them: After the security breach was detected, the flight was delayed and the 400 passengers rescreened. If you have been screened in the last 180 days, you do not need to be rescreened.
to show a film or television programme again: The BBC is considering re-screening the documentary as part of its 25th anniversay coverage. The TV channel marked the actor's death by rescreening an interview with him from the late 70s.
More examplesFewer examplesPatients are invited back after three months to be rescreened for any remaining signs of infection.More than 50 flights were delayed, sniffer dogs were brought in, and passengers were re-screened.A spokesperson for Channel 5, which is rescreening the show, dismissed the criticism.
